task.title: Searching the World Wide Web
task.shortdesc: There is a lot of information stored on the Web. To access it, all you need is a computer, an internet connection, and a web browser.

context.p: For AirClassroom, we will be using Google Chrome as a web browser, which is often shortened as Chrome.

step.cmd: On the home screen, move your mouse so that the pointer hovers over the Google Chrome icon, and quickly double click the icon using the left button of your mouse.
Google Chrome will open, and you can type a specific website in the search bar at the top, or you can type in any question you want to find out using the popular search engine Google.
step.info: If you want to find certain information or a specific website, you can do so using basic terms or asking a full question. For example, if you wanted to find out when Pizza Hut closes, you can search "What are the hours at Pizza Hut near me?" or "pizza hut 24060". The same results should appear.

step.cmd: Some information does not show up as easily as shown above. After typing in the information you want to know and pressing Return, use your mouse to select the link that looks the most helpful to you.

To scroll down the page, use your mouse pointer on the screen to select the gray scroll bar on the far right of the page. Click and hold the left button on the mouse to move up or down the page, and release the button when you reach the place on the screen you would like to stop at.

If you find that you clicked the wrong link or want to go back to the previous options, select the Back arrow button in the top left of the browser. Hold down the click on the button for a few seconds to allow the previous website options to appear, and you can quickly select one of them. Similarly, if you want to go back forward to the page you went back from, select the Forward arrow button.
